title: Inflation rate in Malaysia 2024
yAxis: Inflation rate compared to previous year
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Inflation rate compared to previous year. In total the number of data points it has is 41.
In general Inflation rate compared to previous year has fallen over the Year.
The most drastic decrease took place within the Year 2008 and 2009.
The highest Inflation rate compared to previous year, of value 5.43 was reached at Year 2008
Minimum Inflation rate compared to previous year about 0.29 was reached at Year 1988
min_summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Inflation rate compared to previous year, containing a total of 41 data points.
Overall Inflation rate compared to previous year has decreased over the Year.

max_summary: The chart generally has many fluctuations.
The chart generally has many fluctuations.
This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Inflation rate compared to previous year, containing a total of 41 data points.
Overall Inflation rate compared to previous year has decreased over the Year.
The chart in general has a zig-zag shape.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2008 and 2009.
The highest Inflation rate compared to previous year, of value 5.43 was reached at Year 2008
Minimum Inflation rate compared to previous year about 0.29 was reached at Year 1988

The line significantly decreased by 2.24 from Year 1985 to 1986,increased by 0.39 from Year 1986 to 1987,increased by 2.27 from Year 1988 to 1989,increased by 2.63 from Year 1997 to 1998,increased by 1.62 from Year 2004 to 2005,increased by 3.4 from Year 2007 to 2008,decreased by 4.83 from Year 2008 to 2009,increased by 1.12 from Year 2009 to 2010,increased by 1.45 from Year 2010 to 2011,increased by 1.72 from Year 2016 to 2017,decreased by 2.83 from Year 2017 to 2018, and lastly, increased by 1.06 from Year 2019 to 2020.
